intro: Huodendron tibeticum var. denticulatum, commonly known as the Tibetan toothed honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers, which bloom in summer, range in color from white to pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
